data.text: Which Saddles are Comfortable for Long Days / Multi Day Bike Touring

Hi everyone. I know this is highly subjective, and I will research as much as I can, but I'd be really interested to know your recommendations for saddles which are comfortable for long days/multiple day trips. I have the standard saddle my bike was issued with and it's starting to not be comfortable enough. Thanks so much!

Starting points for me would be Bontrager as they can measure your sit bone and have a wide range of products depending upon how upright/tucked in you like to be. They also offer a 30 day refund (on used products) if you donâ€™t like it, canâ€™t be better than that. Other companies like specialised are similar but think they only offer credit/swap instead of a refund. Going against my own advise, Brookes C19 works well for me

data.text: Another vote for Brooks. I like the Swallow and slightly prefer the titanium to the steel. I am pretty sure I have wider than average sit bones. I notice that my brother goes for B17 and I assume that the swift would also work for narrower sit bones. my wife also uses a brooks despite me buying a whole range of woman specific saddles (barely used from Ebay). I have mainly avoided padded shorts/tights on tour. This contrasts with local riding where I use a range of modern saddles and padded gear. Of the modern saddles I prefer my Rido saddle from SJS. The design doesn't look comfortable but perches you high up. I would just add that doing LEJOG in 2017 on a very old and damp Swallow I did injure myself and took a couple of years to recover - so keep your saddle dry and keep it tensioned and if its wet wet wet maybe leather is not the best. Also even Brooks saddles dont last for ever. Incidentally I did rehabilitate the offending saddle - a fairly complex process involving heating the leather!
